message: I'm excited to offer you this unique opportunity to purchase a one-of-a-kind product. I believe it has tremendous value and potential. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1500000.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1200000. Can we meet in the middle?

I appreciate your interest in the product and I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1300000. It's a fair price considering the product's unique features and value.
I'm willing to pay a premium for the product, but $1300000 is still a bit steep for me. I can do $1250000, but that's as high as I'm willing to go.

I understand that $1250000 is as high as you're willing to go, but I'm not quite ready to accept that price yet. I'm willing to compromise and meet you at $1280000. I believe the product's value justifies this price, and I'm confident you'll find it worth every penny.
I'm still a bit hesitant, but I'm willing to meet you at $1280000. Can you throw in some extras or provide more information about the product to justify the price?
